article:
'Compartmentalization' or 'compartmentalisation' may refer to:

* Cellular compartments, which comprise all closed parts within a cell
* Compartmentalization (engineering), the separating of two or more parts of a
  system to prevent malfunctions from spreading between or among them
* Compartmentalization (fire protection), the concept of dividing a structure
  into compartments to limit the spread of fire
* Compartmentalization (information security), the limiting of access to
  information in order to improve security
* Compartmentalization (psychology), the act of splitting an idea or concept
  into parts and trying to enforce their distinctness in the mind
* Compartmentalization of decay in trees (CODIT)
